description: From Ancient Greek ἀν- (an-) + ἐγκέφαλος (enképhalos, “within the head”) + -ia, from ἐν (en, “in”) + κεφαλή (kephalḗ, “head”).

entries.meaning: The state of being without that which is within the head, absence of a brain; anencephaly.
examples: praeterea pluries ſimul obſervatum fuit cum anencephalia
